description: Convert your TIFF to JPG for easier sharing and smaller files. This free online converter turns professional TIFF images into universally supported JPEGs while keeping strong visual quality. Multi-page TIFFs are flattened and only the first page is converted. If your TIFF has transparency, JPG will render those areas on a solid background (white by default).

head.og_title: TIFF to JPG Converter - Free & Online
head.og_description: Convert TIFF images into JPG format with high quality and smaller file sizes. 100% free, fast, and secure.

h1.title: Convert TIFF to JPG Online
h1.description: Free and fast TIFF to JPG converter with high quality and smaller file sizes. Works instantly on any device — no signup required.

h2.title: Why Convert TIFF to JPG?
h2.description:
TIFF is ideal for editing and print, but it’s heavy and less compatible. JPG strikes a practical balance:

  • Much Smaller Files: Often 70–90% smaller than TIFF, depending on content.
  • Universal Compatibility: JPG works on virtually every device and app.
  • Easy Sharing: Perfect for email, messaging, and the web.
  • Storage Savings: Reduce space without major visual loss.

h2.title: How to Convert TIFF to JPG Online
h2.description:
1. Click Upload TIFF and choose your file.
  2. Wait for processing and optimization.
  3. Click Download JPG to save your image.

We use progressive JPEG (mozjpeg) for great size–quality balance.

h2.title: TIFF vs JPG Comparison
h2.description:
• Compression: TIFF can be lossless; JPG is lossy for smaller files.
  • Transparency: TIFF may include alpha; JPG has none (transparent pixels become solid).
  • Color: TIFF may be CMYK/AdobeRGB; JPG output is standardized to sRGB for the web.
  • Use Case: Keep TIFF for editing/print masters; use JPG for delivery and sharing.

h2.title: Supported Limits & Formats
h2.description:
• Accepted input: TIFF (image/tiff)
  • Maximum file size: up to 16 MB per file
  • Output: JPG (.jpg, image/jpeg)
  • Pages: Multi-page TIFFs: only the first page is converted

h2.title: Troubleshooting
h2.description:
• Colors look different: We convert to sRGB for web consistency. Soft-proof in sRGB before upload if possible.
  • Transparency lost: JPG doesn’t support alpha; use TIFF → PNG if you need transparency.
  • File still large: Reduce resolution or lower quality to 80–85%.
  • Upload fails: Ensure TIFF and ≤ 16 MB.

faq.question: Is this TIFF to JPG converter free?
faq.answer: Yes, it’s completely free with no watermarks or hidden charges.

faq.question: Will I lose quality when converting TIFF to JPG?
faq.answer: JPG is lossy, but we use high-quality settings (mozjpeg, progressive) to minimize visible loss.

faq.question: Does JPG keep transparency?
faq.answer: No. JPG has no alpha channel. Transparent areas in the source will be filled with a solid background (white by default).

faq.question: Can you handle multi-page TIFFs?
faq.answer: Yes, but we convert only the first page. If needed, split pages before upload.

faq.question: What file sizes are supported?
faq.answer: You can upload images up to 16 MB per file.

faq.question: Can I convert multiple TIFF files at once?
faq.answer: This page converts one file at a time. For bulk needs, repeat the process.

note: JPG is lossy and removes transparency. Keep your original TIFF for editing or print, and export JPG for sharing.
